alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:44PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Halifax County through 845 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Littleton, or 14 miles southwest of Roanoke Rapids, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Littleton, Weldon, South Weldon, Airlie, Rosemary, Tillery, Roanoke Rapids Lake and Medoc Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
